titleStmt.title: V. B. Young et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG4469

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: To Thomas E Bramlett Govenor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

Your Petitioner Phillip Williams would most respectfully represent. that at the March Term of the Bath Circuit Court 1858.. the Commonwealth recovered two Judgments against your petitioner for $20. each for gameing= Your petitioner would state that the "Commonwealth is better able to lose that amount, than he is to pay it, and he would state that he has long since quit betting, and he prays your excellency to remit said fines- and He will ever pray &c

V. B. Young C. B. C. C
B D Lacy
N, P. Reid.
John Miller
Robert Coulthard
B F Trumbo
George Cayle
Jos S Swetnam
J A Trumbo
Thos Fadeley
W F, Atkinson
Remit except costs & fees -- and hand to Judge Trumbo
